results.title: city diary_02
results.brief_description: An anonymous digital dairy created by a young person as part of a day long workshop run by ACMI. Each diary is scripted and a voiceover recorded by the individual young person. Some diaries use photographs brought in by the participant, but the primary visual content is often black and white, ‘stock’ footage of a poetic nature. At no point should the creator or school be positively identified when screening this work.

results.title: City centre developments (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Graeme Turner, Open University, BBC-TV and Alberta Educational Commission Corp
results.brief_description: Looks at capitalist Vancouver, mixed economy Birmingham and socialist Cracow, noting the influences which cause city centres to change in character, function and population.

results.title: City bound
results.creator_credit: Ivan Scott, Spectator Productions, Denning Films and Robin Carruthers
results.brief_description: A study of London’s transport system during World War II. Between 5.30am and 10.00am each morning London’s underground and above-ground transport fleet carried nearly five million workers to city offices, shops, factories, and dockyards; many of these people lived in the most distant residential outer suburbs of London, and were brought in to the city every day from distances of up to 30 miles or more away. “City bound” shows us the daily migration by train, tram, bus, and tube.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Scott, Spectator Productions, Denning Films and Robin Carruthers

results.title: Citizen army
results.brief_description: The Citizen Military Forces form an important part of Australia’s defence program. This film shows the men of the CMF, citizens in uniform, in a mock assault on an objective during training.

results.title: Cities of the future
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, Gordon Hyatt and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses radical approaches to town planning, showing various concepts. The totally planned new city, Brasilia; incorporation of historic elements as in Philadelphia; pedestrian areas in Miami and Montreal; planned residential extensions; and suggested new construction methods. Exciting architectural ideas include: weather-proofed cities, mega-structures surrounded by green-belts, multi-level cities and floating cities. Features some animated scenes. Narrated by Walter Cronkite and animated by John Hubley.

results.title: Cities in crisis: what's happening?
results.creator_credit: Universal City Studios Productions and Ray Witlin
results.brief_description: The first in a series dealing with environmental pollution. this film juxtaposes scenes of congestion, pollution, and decay which are the results of uncontrolled growth, inadequate planning and insufficient concern in a sprawling metropolitan city. Exposes the social, economic and moral values that have permitted the megalopolis to arise. No spoken commentary.

results.title: Cities in crisis II: a matter of survival
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts and Ray Witlin
results.brief_description: Alarming levels of pollution parallel with urban and industrial growth are being recorded in the metropolitan areas of the United States. Land, air, water and the human ear are victims of this pollution. This film contrasts scenes of rural beauty accompanied by readings from Walt Whitman with the rising accumulations of refuse and decay that threaten the nation’s health.

results.title: Cirque du soleil: Quidam
results.creator_credit: Rocky Oldham, Serpent Films, Cirque du Soleil Images and David Mallet
results.brief_description: Cirque du Soleil’s “Quidam” is an exciting, beautifully choreographed, opulent performance. Recorded live in Amsterdam, this unique circus incorporates acrobatics, music, performance art and theatre. Sung in French with English subtitles.
